tags.access:description: Camping fees apply 1 May to 30 September. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2018) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.
tags.description: Upland camping. Several sites on Perry Lagoon SE of tombolo, a few sites on Coon Bay proper. Pit toilets. Authorized camping at defined Sandstone and Perry Lagoon sites only. Resident camp host in summer. Food cache.
tags.description:boat_approach: Coon Bay - steep sand beach. N aspect. Surf possible. Current hazards. Enter at slack. Alternate access by Perry Lagoon to SE of tombolo. Enter extreme E of lagoon entrance. Dries at low water.
tags.description:other: Water at pump. Sandstone headlands, wildflowers, tidal lagoon (Perry Lagoon). No sanctioned road or trail access. Existing hiking trails unconnected to road system to discourage car-based camping, but much use by cyclists continues Also used by power boat
tags.name: Coon Bay Campground (BCMT)
tags.water_source:description: Water is available from May 1 â€“ September 30. A boil water advisory is in place.

tags.description: Numbered site each with a picnic table plus possible additional random sites in open grass field. Less suited for hammocks. Pit, vault toilets. No fires permitted. Food cache. Dining shelter.
tags.description:landing: Easy on sand, pebble, rock in sheltered cove. Mud at low water. Alternate landing on E side of island 48D 56.283M N, 123D 32.650M W known locally as Honeymoon Bay. Short trail leads to camping area.
tags.description:other: Historic buildings. Bring water - closest availability Montague Harbour Provincial Park, Dionisio Point Provincial Park. Hiking trails.
tags.name: Conovoer Cove Campsite (BCMT)
tags.reservation:description: Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.

tags.description: Tent pads for 2 tents, placed close together. Camp only on designated sites. 2 picnic tables. Pit toilet at Chivers Point site 10 min walk away.. No fires permitted. Stairs lead up steep bank to trail.
tags.description:en: Attractive, Bring water - closest available Montague Harbour Provincial Park, Dionisio Point Provincial Park. Promontory suited to day use. Hiking trails.
tags.description:landing: Boat run through rocks onto sand, pebbles or rock ledges between rock ribs at neck behind small promontory. Slight Exposure to N. Alternative landing from SE at high water. Approach from NW suited to all tide levels unless blocked by drift logs.
tags.name: Cabin Bay Campsite (BCMT)
tags.reservation:description: Camping fees apply year-round. Pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites or pay at site. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.

tags.description: 9 tent pads of gravel, wood. Vault toilet, picnic table at each tent pad, food cache. No fires permitted.
tags.description:landing: Sand, pebble, rock beach, rocky ridges at low water. Narrow approach. Beach mostly floods at high water. Exposed to NW.
tags.description:other: Attractive. View from low ridge above tent sites.Bring water - available Montague Harbour Provincial Park, Dionisio Point Provincial Park. Hiking trails. Most popular of 3 sites on island for paddlers.
tags.name: Chivers Point Campsite (BCMT)
tags.reservation:description: Camping fees apply year-round. Pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites or pay at site. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System.

tags.description: Walk-in sites with wooden tent pads, picnic tables, 1 vault, 1 composting toilets. Access from beach top via stair up steep bank to N. No fires permitted. Campers must remove all garbage.
tags.description:landing: Easy on moderate to steep gradient shell, gravel beach facing Ruxton Passage in cove S of Pirates Cove proper. Some exposure to S.
tags.description:other: Potable water at pump 200 m from tent area. Walking trails. 2 dinghy docks in main cove to NW. Anchorage in adjacent NW (main) cove.
tags.name: Pirates Cove Campsite (BCMT)
tags.reservation:description: Camping fees apply year-round. May pre-pay permit via Internet, but no reservable sites. Fee $5.00 per person per night (2019) via BC Parks Backcountry Registration System or in drop box near water pump.

tags.description: Informal camp on Crown land. Undeveloped, large semi-exposed level area on islet top.
tags.description:landing: Moderate to difficult, on rock ledges at W shore approx 70 m SE of main tenting area indicated on map. Swells, current hazards, vessel traffic.
tags.description:other: West Vancouver Yacht Club outstation nearby on main Kendrick Island W shore. Anchorage. Adjacent to Wakes Cove Provincial Park but not within Park.
tags.name: South Kendrick Islet Informal Camp (BCMT)
